snippet: The music’s concerts and festivals now have profit margins that Wall Street is starting to notice, but determining the value of the promoting companies and the risks associated with live music events pose challenges for investors.
abstract: Electronic dance music’s popular concerts and festivals have profit margins that Wall Street is starting to notice, but determining the value of the promoting companies and the risks associated with live music events pose challenges for investors; for an industry reliant on aging headliners like Bruce Springsteen, the appeal of a genre with fresh stars and a huge young audience is undeniable.
lead_paragraph: The music’s concerts and festivals now have profit margins that Wall Street is starting to notice, but determining the value of the promoting companies and the risks associated with live music events pose challenges for investors.

headline.main: Electronic Dance Concerts Turn Up Volume, Tempting Investors
headline.print_headline: Electronic Dance Concerts Turn Up Volume, Tempting Investors
